bwwExcerpt: As for the appealing Radcliffe, he's eager to please but lacks a certain urgency that makes Finch dangerous and irresistible at the same time. He's no singer ('I Believe in You,' the show's best-known song, barely makes an impression) and not much of a dancer. Still, he does both more than respectably in the rousing 'Brotherhood of Man' finale, which sends us home in a forgiving mood.
